articles.title: TIME100 AI 2025: Cristiano Amon
articles.author: Amrita Khalid
articles.summary: Qualcomm acquired the generative-AI division of startup VinAI earlier this year. The end goal for Qualcomm is to develop AI software that can scale across industries, including mobile, PCs, vehicles, and smart glasses. Qualcomm has invited developers to create on-device AI apps with an AI hub, released in 2024.

articles.title: TIME100 AI 2025: Regina Barzilay
articles.author: Annalisa Merelli
articles.summary: Regina Barzilay was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2014. She and her team developed an AI model called MIRAI, which can predict a patient's risk of developing breast cancer within five years. It was validated by over 2 million mammograms in 48 hospitals across 22 countries by 2025. In 2024, she worked on a model that estimates the effectiveness of candidate flu vaccines. She's now working on using the same concept on cancer, to predict how patients will react to a specific treatment.

articles.title: TIME100 AI 2025: David Ha
articles.author: Harry Booth
articles.summary: Sakana AI is developing AI solutions for MUFG, one of Japan's largest banks. In February, it retracted its claim of a hundred-fold programming acceleration after X users pointed out its AI had exploited a software bug to 'cheat' an evaluation. Sakana AI has since implemented more robust tests.

articles.title: A hacker turned a popular AI tool into a cybercrime machine
articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: Anthropic warns about cybercriminals' growing use of AI tools as the technology becomes increasingly sophisticated. The company behind the popular AI chatbot Claude has issued a chilling warning about this trend. It warns of how criminals can use AI tools for reconnaissance, credential harvesting and network penetration at scale.

articles.title: Three Strategies Defining The Future Of Public Relations

articles.summary: Kurt Allen, LSSBB, Vice President, Marketing & Communications at Notre Dame de Numur University talks about the changing nature of public relations. He recommends real-time engagement, AI-driven insights and unified communication as the key to PR's success.

articles.title: Building Responsible AI Strategies: A Playbook For Senior Leaders
articles.author: Ori Lev-Ran
articles.summary: Ori is CRO at Teramind, helping enterprises scale securely through AI and data-driven GTM strategies. He advises senior leaders to make sure their AI systems are accountable, fair and aligned with their values before deploying it. He also suggests to bring in people from legal, HR, security and DEI from the get-go.

articles.title: The Last Mile Of AI: Why Deployments Stall And What To Do About It
articles.author: Alessa Cross
articles.summary: Alessa Cross is on the founding team at Ventrilo AI. She believes that AI gains haven't always translated into product value. The downstream layers of interpretation and learning represent the "last mile" of AI deployments. The guiding question should change from "Is this prediction correct?" to "What decision does this enable?"

articles.title: Vibe coding is here to stay — but engineers and computer scientists say 'learn to code' is still good advice

Doctors at four endoscopy centers in Poland were given access to an A.I tool that flagged suspicious growths while they performed a colonoscopy.
